tweets.fullText: RT @googledevs: Gemma 3 is here! The collection of lightweight, state-of-the-art open models are built from the same research and technolog‚Ä¶

This is wild.

Google just unleashed Gemini Robotics, bringing AI into the physical world.

Robots can now see, think, and ACT in real-time.

10 mind-blowing things Gemini Robotics can do: https://t.co/Bj8nfND0FW

threadTexts.text:
1. Dexterity

Completes precise tasks, like origami folding handled entirely by AI-driven robots ü§Ø https://t.co/v1Pq19kk0H

2. Interactivity

Understands commands in everyday language.

Quickly adapts if objects move or environment changes. https://t.co/uMkhfxugEg

3. Generality

Instantly handles new tasks and objects.

Performs tasks it's never seen before, doubling other models‚Äô performance. https://t.co/e7tXJvan1q

4. World Understanding (Gemini Robotics-ER)

Understands objects‚Äô shape and position instantly.

Plans safe, accurate movements to grasp and manipulate objects. https://t.co/2xQEDB1Sy4

5. Multiple Embodiments

Works across various robots, including humanoid models like Apollo.

Easily adapts to different robotic hardware. https://t.co/bq6jXweCMR

Follow me @minchoi and please Bookmark, Like, Comment & Repost the first Post below to share with your friends:
https://t.co/F0vLciAIOC

It's pretty crazy that I pay $100/year for Google One, $15/month for YouTube Premium, $85/month for YouTube TV, but if I want to use any AI features in Google Docs I‚Äôs need to pay $20 more a month.

The Perplexity API Model Context Protocol (MCP) is now available.

We've built an MCP server for Sonar, giving AI assistants real-time, web search research capabilities.

Powered by Perplexity, Claude can now search the web and deliver real-time and accurate insights on demand. https://t.co/TxxkaD9CLt

Get started today:

https://t.co/8BMJMHRF8a

Connect your LlamaIndex agents to any Model Context Protocol server!

We're closely following progress on the Model Context Protocol, an open-source effort to make it easy to discover and use tools. Using our MCP integration, you can use the tools exposed by any MCP-compatible‚Ä¶ https://t.co/4V5LguDL8X

tweets.fullText: Introducing two new AI models from @GoogleDeepMind, based on Gemini 2.0, that lay the foundation for a new generation of helpful robots: Gemini Robotics, a vision-language-action model adds physical actions as a new modality, and Gemini Robotics-ER, a vision-language model that‚Ä¶

RT @minchoi: Video editing isn‚Äôt just for the pros anymore.

With Pikadditions and Pikaframes, anyone can add & swap objects in minutes.

N‚Ä¶

RT @minchoi: This is MeshPad.

AI that can turn sketches into interactive 3D meshes in seconds. ü§Ø https://t.co/xvqzhokYa8

RT @minchoi: OpenAI just dropped their Agent SDK and it's a game-changer for AI developers ü§Ø

Building AI agents just went from weeks to mi‚Ä¶

Meet Gemini Robotics: our latest AI models designed for a new generation of helpful robots. ü§ñ

Based on Gemini 2.0, they bring capabilities such as better reasoning, interactivity, dexterity and generalization into the physical world. üßµ https://t.co/EXRJrmxGxl https://t.co/MeEkRLomXm

threadTexts.text:
Gemini Robotics can solve multi-step tasks that require significant dexterity, such as folding origami üìÑ packing a lunch box ü•ó and more.

See it in action ‚Üì https://t.co/WgHfQz8n9N
‚öôÔ∏è It goes head to head with our team to wrap a timing belt around gears - a feat that‚Äôs harder than you think ‚Üì https://t.co/Q9D5s7Md7d

Robots must be able to interact seamlessly with humans. ü§ù

When it‚Äôs interrupted or situations change, Gemini Robotics can adjust its actions on the fly.

This level of steerability will empower us to better work with future robot assistants in the home, at work and beyond. https://t.co/3JuPAifFCX

They also accomplished tasks not seen in training, showing the ability to generalize to new scenarios. üí°

We show that on average, Gemini Robotics more than doubles performance on a comprehensive generalization benchmark - compared to other state-of-the-art‚Ä¶ https://t.co/rqgRiM2hRs

Our model Gemini Robotics-ER allows roboticists to tap into the embodied reasoning of Gemini. üåê

For example, if a robot came across a coffee mug, it could detect it, use ‚Äòpointing‚Äô to recognize parts it could interact with - like the handle - and recognize objects to avoid when‚Ä¶ https://t.co/HQMXvWLoJ5

Our ultimate goal is to develop AI that could work for any robot - no matter its shape or size.

This includes bi-arm platforms like ALOHA 2 and Franka ü¶æ
but also for more complex embodiments such as the Apollo developed by @Apptronik. https://t.co/dPd5JtyWpo

We're partnering with @Apptronik to build the next generation of humanoid robots with Gemini 2.0 - and opening our Gemini Robotics-ER model to trusted testers such as Agile Robots, @AgilityRobotics, @BostonDynamics and @EnchantedTools.

Find out more ‚Üí https://t.co/EXRJrmxGxl https://t.co/dtEV6DX0A8

Google DeepMind just dropped Gemma 3 and it‚Äôs a big deal.

This is the most powerful AI you can run on a single GPU or TPU.

That means fast, efficient AI that works on everything from laptops to high-end workstations, no need for expensive cloud setups.

Here‚Äôs why everyone is‚Ä¶ https://t.co/2tTsjiCdfM
